intro: Diosma obtusa, commonly known as the broadleaf diosma, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Diosma obtusa thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
